etymology.description: semantic: 匸 + 品 (simplified from 區 with 品 → 乂)
etymology.interpretation: Enclosure 匸 contains many people 品, evoking a bounded place such as a district or area. The simplification swaps 品 for 乂 to reduce strokes while still suggesting contents within a boundary, so the meaning remains ‘area/region; to divide into areas’.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the inner component 品 with 乂 to reduce stroke count; a graphic simplification without phonetic intent.

examples.chinese: 我住在这个区(我住在這個區)。
这个城市分为五个区(這個城市分為五個區)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège chéngshì fēn wéi wǔ gè qū.
examples.english: This city is divided into five districts.

examples.chinese: 请把教室分区(請把教室分區)。
examples.english: Please divide the classroom into zones.
